verses.verse: (Ex. 28:17-20; Is. 54:11; Ezek. 28:13) The foundations of the wall of the city were adorned with all kinds of precious stones: the first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,
the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth, and the twelfth amethyst.
The twelve gates were twelve (Matt. 13:45, 46) pearls: each individual gate was of one pearl. (Rev. 22:2) And the street of the city was pure gold, like transparent glass.
The Glory of the New Jerusalem (Matt. 24:2; John 4:21, 23) But I saw no temple in it, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.
(Is. 24:23; 60:19, 20; Rev. 21:25; 22:5) The city had no need of the sun or of the moon to shine in it, for the glory of God illuminated it. The Lamb is its light.
(Is. 60:3, 5; 66:12) And the nations of those who are saved shall walk in its light, and the kings of the earth bring their glory and honor into it.
(Is. 60:11) Its gates shall not be shut at all by day (Is. 60:20; Zech. 14:7) (there shall be no night there).
(Rev. 21:24) And they shall bring the glory and the honor of the nations into it.
But (Is. 35:8; Joel 3:17) there shall by no means enter it anything that defiles, or causes an abomination or a lie, but only those who are written in the Lamb’s (Phil. 4:3) Book of Life.
The River of Life And he showed me (Ps. 46:4; Ezek. 47:1; (Zech. 14:8)) a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding from the throne of God and of the Lamb.

(Ezek. 47:12) In the middle of its street, and on either side of the river, was (Gen. 2:9; (Rev. 2:7; 22:14, 19)) the tree of life, which bore twelve fruits, each tree yielding its fruit every month. The leaves of the tree were (Rev. 21:24) for the healing of the nations.
And (Zech. 14:11) there shall be no more curse, (Ezek. 48:35) but the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it, and His (Rev. 7:15) servants shall serve Him.
((Ps. 17:15; 42:2; Matt. 5:8; 1 Cor. 13:12; 1 John 3:2)) They shall see His face, and (Rev. 14:1) His name shall be on their foreheads.

(Is. 60:19; Rev. 21:23) There shall be no night there: They need no lamp nor (Rev. 7:15) light of the sun, for (Ps. 36:9) the Lord God gives them light. (Dan. 7:18, 27; Matt. 19:28; (Rom. 5:17); 2 Tim. 2:12; Rev. 20:4) And they shall reign forever and ever.

The Time Is Near Then he said to me, (Rev. 19:9) “These words are faithful and true.” And the Lord God of the holy prophets (Rev. 1:1) sent His angel to show His servants the things which must (Heb. 10:37) shortly take place.
((Rev. 3:11)) “Behold, I am coming quickly! (Rev. 1:3) Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.”
Now I, John, saw and heard these things. And when I heard and saw, (Rev. 19:10) I fell down to worship before the feet of the angel who showed me these things.
Then he said to me, (Rev. 19:10) “See that you do not do that. For I am your fellow servant, and of your brethren the prophets, and of those who keep the words of this book. Worship God.”
(Dan. 8:26; Rev. 10:4) And he said to me, “Do not seal the words of the prophecy of this book, (Rev. 1:3) for the time is at hand.
He who is unjust, let him be unjust still; he who is filthy, let him be filthy still; he who is righteous, let him be righteous still; he who is holy, let him be holy still.”
Jesus Testifies to the Churches “And behold, I am coming quickly, and (Is. 40:10; 62:11) My reward is with Me, (Rev. 20:12) to give to every one according to his work.
